title: Drought in Botswana
creator_credit: Harold Eastwood, Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations and United Nations
brief_description: Illustrates the World Food Program famine relief in Botswana which began in 1965 after five years of drought had decimated the country. Relief was provided for over 100,000 Kalahari bushmen. Covers tribal traditions and all aspects of the assistance program.
creator_credit_for_label: Harold Eastwood, Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations and United Nations
